page.title: 03General description final.
page.content: Situated as it is in the foothills of the Pennine Chain, the area is subject to a relatively high rainfall, mainly brought by the prevailing westerlies,sweeping in from the Atlantic.There is often low cloud, even in summer, causing fine drizzle or dampness, when just three miles to the west,Macclesfield, on the edge of the Plain,is experiencing dry conditions. In winter the upland is often badly hit by heavy snowfalls, frequently with severe drifting, which isolate the farmhouses for days at a time. Conditions can be extremely harsh even to the causing of loss of human life.
